title: Blood Moon Yasuo - Wind Wall: nearly invisible or nearly unmissable?
body:
Let me preface this with this: I am not color blind, but I am probably more oblivious than your average League player.

And knowingly being more oblivious than your average player, I tend to assume that my problems are usually of my own creation; however in this case I think my inability to see something is more the fault of Riot than myself.

I have a terribly hard time seeing {{champion:157}}'s 'Wind Wall' ability when he is using the Blood Moon skin. When I first saw the skin I was actually pretty stoked because the red particle would contrast against the overwhelmingly green tint of Summoner's Rift, but seeing them in game the reality fell super short of the expectation.

For reference, some Blood Moon 'Wind Wall' vs the Regular:
http://www.newsoflegends.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Blood-Moon-Yasuo-W-11-1024x640.jpg
https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-llvZCk14Vwg/Vs0pm9qMgWI/AAAAAAAALmQ/HOGEjzSLhHw/s640/yasuow.jpg 
http://lkimg.zamimg.com/shared/guides/221017/images/Yasuo%20W%20Ability%201.png

Why is the Blood Moon version so transparent? 

It's so insubstantial it might as well be a 5 AD buff to Warrior. 

The clarity of the Wind Wall is reducing the clarity of gameplay for me. 

It might as well be called a Wind Window. Wind-O. Window?

Toughts? Puns? Memes?

I think their intent was that the wall itself is fainter, but it has much more pronounced indicator on the ground. But it is just too much of a shift, anybody who played against Yasuo instinctively looks for big wall, and not a zigzag on the ground.

this probably has to do with the human eye's ability to perceive red and blue

we see more blue than red and thus, even though the sky is a rainbow of colors, by our angle from the sun we actually receive enough blue to perceive it as only blue until the peak hours of dusk and dawn
also blue light travels further then red or yellow
